授業目的: The purpose of this course is to enable students to familiarize authentic literary texts in English. Currently many young people enjoy English literature as a form of visual contents, such as movies and videos, and only few people read the written originals. This course will provide you with substantial opportunities to read an original fantasy book written for juvenile readers by Philip Pullman, increase the cultural insights, and think about how reading stories can contribute to learning English.
到達目標:
1. You will be able to read the entire authentic fiction book written by Philip Pullman.
2. You will be able to connect the meaning of story and their own experience.
3. You will be able to exchange their thoughts and insights that they obtain from reading with other students.
4. You will be able to express their thoughts and interpretation of the story in a presentation and essays.
授業方法:
- During the online period: No class on April 16; from April 23, zoom real-time sessions will be conducted at the class time until in-person class is available again. These zoom sessions will be recorded and uploaded on OneDrive. More details will be given via LUNA. You can access the LUNA contents as a "guest" from the link below.
- For the students permitted to take class online during the in-person period: You will participate in the within-class zoom real-time sessions.
